overview_of_class: This is a laboratory course in Psychobiology. Each week the students will receive one or two introductory lectures on the particular technique to be used that week. The remainder of the weekly time (10 or more hours) will be spent in the laboratory using that technique. The content area for study involves brain wave representation of cognitive and emotional processes in humans. Therefore, the techniques utilized center around recording and computer analysis of brain waves. Between one and three original (often publishable) experimental studies are done.
name: Neuroscience & Behavior Laboratory
title: WCAS PSYCH 321-0-20 Neuroscience & Behavior Laboratory
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Prerequisite: Students must complete Psych 205-0 before taking this course.

descriptions.value:
Registration Requirements
110, 205, and 312-1 or 212 or equivalents.

descriptions.value: Andreassi, John L. Psychophysiology: Human Behavior and Physiological Response. 5th Edition, 2006. ISBN: 978-0805849516
